messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] math cd-rom
messages.msgSnippet: Discovery Toys sells many of the Broderbund titles.  They are sold by representatives, but have a website that you can go to. www.discoverytoys.com. Bonnie ...
messages.messageBody:
Discovery Toys sells many of the Broderbund titles. They are sold by
representatives, but have a website that you can go to.
www.discoverytoys.com.

Bonnie


>From: "Annette Naake" <naake1999@...>
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] math cd-rom
>Date: Thu, 13 Jul 2000 21:09:55 CDT
>
>Thanks to all for math cd-rom suggestions recently... We got Mathquest with
>Aladdin by Disney a couple days ago, and my 7yo boy really seems to enjoy
>it. It's giving him good practice in adding and subtracting and has a lot
>of
>little logic games. Nice calm music too.
>
>Chumbo.com was out of stock on many of the titles that interested me,
>though. Several of the titles were by a publisher called Broderbund, but
>when I tried to get to their web site, I was directed to Mattel instead. I
>suppose there's been a buyout or something. Even there many of the title
>were out of stock.
>
>If anyone has any other good sources for educational CD-roms, I'd be
>interested!
>
>Thanks.
>
>Annette
>
>________________________________________________________________________
